page.title: 04Rocester Church.
page.content: St.Michael's belongs to the Church of England.It was built in 1872 to hold 200 people but now only about 20 people attend the services.The Rev.Fothergill is the vicar who says that worship means worth because it is worth going to church to pray and sing to God.There are 7 people in the church choir and 10 people to ring the 8 bells calling people to worship.People have collected money to make a special glass window in the church.A vicar for 7 years Rev. Fothergill prefers happy occasions like celebrations,christenings,confirmations and weddings,but was embarrassed when at one wedding the bride-groom did not turn up.He does not like funerals,they make him sad.Part of the church is beginning to fall down and now needs instant repair.At the end of the church drive is a Lich-gate,an old gate with a porch over the top.
